section.heading: Bicycle Component Overview
section.introduction: This document provides an overview of the key components of a bicycle. It includes descriptions and references to visual aids within a larger technical manual.

component.heading: Frame (Refer to Figure 1.1)
component.description: The bicycle frame is the main structural component, typically constructed from metal tubes welded together. It provides the foundation for all other parts.

component.heading: Wheels (Refer to Figure 1.2)
component.description: The wheels enable movement and consist of the following parts:

component.heading: Seat and Seat Post (Refer to Figure 1.3)
component.description: The seat and seat post provide a comfortable riding position. The seat post inserts into the seat tube, allowing for height adjustment.

component.heading: Handlebar and Stem (Refer to Figure 1.4)
component.description: The handlebar and stem control steering and provide a mounting point for brake levers and shifters.

component.heading: Cranks (Refer to Figure 1.5)
component.description: The cranks are levers that extend from the bottom bracket to the pedals, transferring pedaling force to the drivetrain.

component.heading: Pedals (Refer to Figure 1.6)
component.description: The pedals are platforms for the feet, attaching to the cranks and receiving pedaling force.
